intro: Rangaeris amaniensis, commonly known as the Amani bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tanzania. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at elevations above 2,000 meters. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom during the cooler months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
